item.title: 【UPSCALED】Sting - Seven Days [1080p AI Upscale / PCM 24-bit 48 kHz]
item.description:
Genre: Rock
Style: Pop Rock
Year: 1993
Source: DVD, 576i

"Seven Days" is a song by English rock musician Sting, released in 1993. It is the third single from his fourth studio album Ten Summoner's Tales. The song is a ballad, which was only successful in the United Kingdom and Italy. In the United Kingdom, it reached 25th position. Despite the fact that the song did not reach any charts in the Netherlands, it did become a radio hit.

The music video of this release is ripped from the DVD release of Ten Summoner's Tales.
The 'Ten Summoner's Tales' video was filmed in Sting's 400 year old Wiltshire home, Lake House, at the time of recording the album. This was his first venture as a video album and the release won a Grammy award in 1994 for "Best Long Form Video Of The Year".

Release Info
The video track is upscaled from 576i to 1080p with Topaz Video AI.
The PCM track is Hi-Res (24-bit 48 kHz), default track from the DVD.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited to match the music video.
Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.

item.title: 【UPSCALED】Sting - Shape of my Heart [1080p AI Upscale / PCM 24-bit 48 kHz]
item.description:
Genre: Rock
Style: Pop Rock
Year: 1993
Source: DVD, 576i

"Shape of My Heart" is a song by British musician Sting, released in August 1993 as the fifth single from his fourth solo album, Ten Summoner's Tales (1993). The song was co-written by guitarist Dominic Miller and features harmonica played by Larry Adler. It was used for the end credits of the 1994 film Léon, starring Jean Reno, Gary Oldman and Natalie Portman, and within the 1993 film Three of Hearts. Despite failing to reach the top 50 in the UK upon its release, it has become a pop classic and one of Sting's works most closely associated with his solo career. It has since been sampled in many tracks since its release, including "Shape" (2003) by Sugababes and "Rise & Fall" (2003) by Craig David. Ann-Margret sang a cover over the opening credits of her 1996 movie Blue Rodeo.

The song's guitar riff was also sampled by Nas for his track "The Message" in 1996 and interpolated by Juice WRLD on the worldwide hit "Lucid Dreams" (2018), on "You’re Mines Still" (2020) by rapper BLEU and in "Parkstone Drive" by Russ.

Sting explained that through "Shape of My Heart", he wanted to tell the story of a "card player, a gambler who gambles not to win but to try to figure out something; to figure out some kind of mystical logic in luck, or chance; some kind of scientific, almost religious law."

The accompanying music video for "Shape of My Heart" was directed by Doug Nichol and premiered in September 1993. It was filmed in Sting's 400 year old Wiltshire home, Lake House, at the time of recording the Ten Summoner's Tales album.

Release Info
The video track is upscaled from 576i to 1080p with Topaz Video AI.
The PCM track is Hi-Res (24-bit 48 kHz), default track from the DVD.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited to match the music video.
Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.
